title: The Starry Night
description: A masterpiece depicting a swirling night sky over a village, painted during van Gogh's stay at the asylum of Saint-Paul-de-Mausole.

value.text: One of the most recognizable paintings in the history of Western culture.

title: Self-Portrait with Thorn Necklace and Hummingbird
description: A self-portrait depicting Kahlo with a thorn necklace and a dead hummingbird pendant, symbolizing resurrection.

value.text: The hummingbird symbolizes resurrection in Mexican folk tradition.

title: Les Demoiselles d'Avignon
description: A revolutionary painting that marked the beginning of Cubism, showing five nude female figures composed of flat, splintered planes.

value.text: Considered a seminal work in the development of modern art and Cubism.

title: Black Iris III
description: A close-up painting of an iris flower, showing O'Keeffe's characteristic style of magnifying natural forms.

value.text: Part of O'Keeffe's famous series of enlarged flower paintings.

title: Mona Lisa
description: A half-length portrait painting depicting Lisa Gherardini, wife of a Florentine merchant. Famous for the subject's enigmatic smile.

value.text: The most famous painting in the world, housed in the Louvre Museum.

title: Guernica
description: A large oil painting showing the tragedies of war and the suffering it inflicts upon individuals, particularly innocent civilians.

value.text: Created in response to the bombing of Guernica during the Spanish Civil War.

title: The Two Fridas
description: A double self-portrait showing two versions of Frida Kahlo sitting side by side, representing her dual heritage and emotional state.

value.text: Painted during Kahlo's divorce from Diego Rivera, showing her emotional turmoil.

title: The Potato Eaters
description: A painting of a peasant family eating potatoes, intended to show the harsh reality of rural life.

value.text: Van Gogh considered this painting to be his first great work.
